intro: Hemizonia congesta subsp. typica, commonly known as the clustered hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. It is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, where it thrives in full sun.
